alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morgan, western Johnson, northern Magoffin and southwestern Elliott Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cottle, or over West Liberty, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Florress, White Oak, Elkfork, Holliday and Crockett around 415 PM EDT. Matthew, Dingus, Williams, Jeptha and Harper around 420 PM EDT. Orient, Haleburg, Logville, Cisco, Silverhill, Bloomington, Wonnie, Mima, Patton and Bethanna around 425 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Coon, Ever, Quod, Plutarch, Tella, Grayfox, Lacey, Licksburg, Ophir, Elsie, Salyersville, Leatha, Wheelersburg, Flat Fork, Cyrus, Perlie, Minefork, Stringtown, Win, Elna, Mason, Falcon, Brownlow, Niles, Mashfork, Hargis, Burning Fork, Lakesville, Ballot, Oil Springs, Conley, Ivyton and Bradley. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 68 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
